channel.title: Burning downloaded movies to a DVD
channel.description:
[center][size=20pt]Burning downloaded movies to a DVD[/size][/center] Okay, after j4m3s' request, i'll describe how to burn movies onto a DVD. [b]What you need[/b] [ul][li]A (downloaded) movie, in a common movie format (e.g. AVI, MPG, RM etc)[/li] [li]WinAVI (see below)[/li] [li]DVD burner, including blank DVDR disk[/li][/ul] [b]Download[/b] First, get WinAVI from here. http://www2.winavi.com/download/WinAVI_Video_Converter.exe [b]Registering[/b] After install, enter one of the following serials:
81EB08509412206901BBB40BFA9CE747BD6A9DDDF6B14E29 3002B9B98C927E6CCD5C63C01517A8F8C07B5B0B3468F442 FB96722D33B674A864C3A35CB6DFBDA8C98F224B3C7DA76A 29D4A06F39B3C0F964675DE889D98571873FE1C8756352F8 F46D7DD6D9667F56B53896D7A90DBE9F93B6C7DEE2348811 B0EF3954BAA8DC5F03272F857C98906BC6E0B0FBDC18DC85 F3597AE204B9B467580E20B0AB45021B6DE0C6AEF959D6C0
No, this is not illegal, just, erm, dont use them :rolleyes: [b]Converting[/b] Okay, press the DVD button, as shown in the picture. [URL=http://img100.imageshack.us/my.php?image=winavi1fb3.png][IMG]http://img100.imageshack.us/img100/6828/winavi1fb3.png[/img][/URL] Browse to your video file, and double click it. [URL=http://img216.imageshack.us/my.php?image=winavi2cm5.png][IMG]http://img216.imageshack.us/img216/3310/winavi2cm5.png[/img][/URL] 1. Select output directory, like C:\MOVIE_NAME 2. Select DVD 3. Press advanced, you'll see this: [URL=http://img216.imageshack.us/my.php?image=winavi3ha4.png][IMG]http://img216.imageshack.us/img216/6320/winavi3ha4.png[/img][/URL] 1. Disc size should be 4300MB, 1 disc 2. AUTO is most common for the video size, but if you have a widescreen, you'd better select 16:9 3. Audio bitrate, 192000 is fine 4. If you have a PAL dvd player, you'd select PAL. (Most european dvd players have this). American people have NTSC. If you're not sure, ask your dvd supplier. Also, if your movie has an AC3 codec, check the box "Enable DirectAC3" Press [OK] [URL=http://img146.imageshack.us/my.php?image=winavi4ww5.png][IMG]http://img146.imageshack.us/img146/7633/winavi4ww5.png[/img][/URL] It's converting woohoo! :P [b]Burning[/b] Okay, fire up your burning program (i use nero) and make a new DVD. Add two folders to it. The structure must be like this: DVD_ROOT |-AUDIO_TS |- [no files, leave it empty, just create folder] |-VIDEO_TS |- [b][ALL files WinAVI outputted go here! Including every vob, sub whatever file][/b] Press BURN (or whatever it's called) and let it do it's job. Open your drive after it's finished, and watch a movie on your TV! :D I really hope this is helpful. A little thanks would be appreciated :) ~S!ms

item.source: Burning downloaded movies to a DVD

item.title: Burning downloaded movies to a DVD
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“S!ms, post:1, topic:27539”][center][size=20pt]Burning downloaded movies to a DVD[/size][/center]

Okay, after j4m3s’ request, i’ll describe how to burn movies onto a DVD.

What you need

[ul][li]A (downloaded) movie, in a common movie format (e.g. AVI, MPG, RM etc)[/li]
[li]WinAVI (see below)[/li]
[li]DVD burner, including blank DVDR disk[/li][/ul]

Download
First, get WinAVI from here.
http://www2.winavi.com/download/WinAVI_Video_Converter.exe

Registering
After install, enter one of the following serials:

[quote]81EB08509412206901BBB40BFA9CE747BD6A9DDDF6B14E29
3002B9B98C927E6CCD5C63C01517A8F8C07B5B0B3468F442
FB96722D33B674A864C3A35CB6DFBDA8C98F224B3C7DA76A
29D4A06F39B3C0F964675DE889D98571873FE1C8756352F8
F46D7DD6D9667F56B53896D7A90DBE9F93B6C7DEE2348811
B0EF3954BAA8DC5F03272F857C98906BC6E0B0FBDC18DC85
F3597AE204B9B467580E20B0AB45021B6DE0C6AEF959D6C0[/quote]
No, this is not illegal, just, erm, dont use them :rolleyes:

Converting
Okay, press the DVD button, as shown in the picture.

Browse to your video file, and double click it.

  1. Select output directory, like C:\MOVIE_NAME
  2. Select DVD
  3. Press advanced, you’ll see this:

  1. Disc size should be 4300MB, 1 disc
  2. AUTO is most common for the video size, but if you have a widescreen, you’d better select 16:9
  3. Audio bitrate, 192000 is fine
  4. If you have a PAL dvd player, you’d select PAL. (Most european dvd players have this). American people have NTSC. If you’re not sure, ask your dvd supplier.
    Also, if your movie has an AC3 codec, check the box “Enable DirectAC3”

Press [OK]


It’s converting woohoo!

Burning
Okay, fire up your burning program (i use nero) and make a new DVD. Add two folders to it. The structure must be like this:
DVD_ROOT
|-AUDIO_TS
|- [no files, leave it empty, just create folder]
|-VIDEO_TS
|- [ALL files WinAVI outputted go here! Including every vob, sub whatever file]

Press BURN (or whatever it’s called) and let it do it’s job. Open your drive after it’s finished, and watch a movie on your TV!

I really hope this is helpful. A little thanks would be appreciated
~S!ms[/quote]
[flash=200,200]http://flash.gprime.net/media/flash/youareapirate.swf[/flash]

Read full topic

@frank_, ogm should work
